document.docAuthor: Miller, Kelly B. & Wolfe, G. William
document.docTitle: Desmopachria clotho Miller and Wolfe 2019, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Three New Species in the Desmopachria striola Species-Group of Desmopachria Babington, 1841 (Coleoptera: Adephaga: Dytiscidae: Hydroporinae: Hyphydrini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three New Species in the Desmopachria striola Species-Group of Desmopachria Babington, 1841 (Coleoptera: Adephaga: Dytiscidae: Hydroporinae: Hyphydrini)

, new species

Figs. 25–26. Distribution of new
Desmopachria species.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species differs from others in the group by the shape of the male genitalia. The median lobe is elongate and evenly and strongly curved apically in lateral aspect ( Fig. 6 ). In ventral aspect, the median lobe is moderately deeply bifid with each ramus apically expanded and truncate ( Fig. 7 ). Specimens are evenly orange on the dorsum of the head and pronotum and evenly red-brown on the elytra. The shape of the male genitalia and the dorsal coloration are not particularly similar to any other member of the
D. striola
species-group.
Description. Measurements: TL = 1.4–1.5 mm , GW = 1.0 mm, PW = 0.7–.08 mm, HW = 0.5 mm , EW = 0.2–0.3 mm , TL/GW = 1.4–1.6, HW/EW = 1.8–1.9. Coloration: Head and pronotum orange,

caption.paragraph: Table 1. Snow Entomology Museum Collection, University of Kansas (KUNHM) accession numbers for

Desmopachria
specimens of new species described herein.

subSubSection.paragraph:
D. atropos SEMC
1030582, SEMC1030664, SEMC1030694, SEMC1030705, SEMC1030735

Etymology. This species is named
clotho
(spinner) after one of the three Greek fates.

Distribution.
Desmopachria clotho
is known only from one locality in Sipaliwini District in Suriname ( Fig. 25 ).
Habitat. The type series was collected from a “pond.”

Type Material.
Holotype in MIZA , male labeled “ SURINAME : Sipaliwini District N3°55.600
0
W56°11.300
0

Desmopachria clotho Miller and Wolfe, 2017
[red label with black line border].”

Desmopachria clotho Miller and Wolfe, 2017
[blue label with black line border].”
